Lonely Road #92, Lady K’s First Visit

Posted on November 16, 2012 by mike

June 28, 2009:

A giant sword. Tattoos galore. Zero inhibitions. A “take” on Little Red Riding Hood. An incredibly gorgeous bottom. “Bling” from TJ Max. Climbing in Joshua trees. A gun-toting Nazi atop a shell-shocked fridge. A wine bottle from Oregon. Hmmmm…what else?

Welcome to Lady K and her world, people. Man, this is one amazing gal you’re about to meet, everyone. She is a horse-training, mega-pierced lady, cute as hell, who totally rocked my Lonely Roads world on June 28, 2009. In fact, she rocked it so much that you’ll see her again in a forthcoming shoot and you’ll also catch her in my book waving to a very appreciative Harley-rider! Yeah, Lady K!!

One of the things that I love most about her was the fact that she really worked hard on bringing “herself” to the shoot. And, by that I mean that I always encourage the gals I shot for the Lonely project to bring elements of themselves and their lives: their hobbies, passions, fetishes….anything that they truly identify with. And, we’d then incorporate those elements into the photos. Well, fabulous Lady K went all out. A giant sword, some pretty cool clothing, a new bling-belt she just bought specifically for our shoot…and even a rifle that belongs to her dad. (And you’re soon to see more of the guns/gals type stuff as Lady K helped kickstart my notion of a calendar with guns and gorgeous girls….). And, we were then gifted by nature as we found some perfect locations for her stuff: A barbed wire fence to work with her bling belt; how about an overturned, shot-up fridge covered in graffiti?? Oh, yeah, great things happen on the Lonely Road especially when I have such a great companion to work with.

Lovely Lady K …..fyi….also had NEVER done anything like this. Brand-new to modeling, and a complete virgin to the “naked in public” program of mine…so it’s hard to believe she was so comfy with everything. And, if you don’t believe me…check her out here, applying her makeup, minutes after arriving at the first location we were to shoot at:

Makeup application with LadyK on the Lonely Road

Nice, huh? I seemingly sneak up on her. Totally amateur. Yet she totally played along with my stupid video! That’s because I’m so damn fun to shoot with! Hello!!!! But, in all honesty, I love this lady and hope she plans on making another appearance for my project amidst her Tucson travels and equestrian programs.

Well…I’ve loaded 20 pics to share on this entry because I think it was such a wonderful shoot, full of such variety, and featuring somebody so genuine and excited to partake. One shot features a very appropriately labeled bottle from the Naked Winery in Hood River, OR. I also giggle at the shot I tried to capture of me “shooting” her while being reflected in the window of my van. Mr. Detail, here, forgot to remove the red clip holding her fabric in place!I think that will emphasize just how professional and classy my work can be! 🙂  Checkout the incredible jumps she did at the end of our day…in black and white…as I think they truly are stunning. You’ll also see this gutsy tomboy perched way up in a Joshua tree….and I think the band U2 would be very proud. Hell…maybe “Where the streets have no name” was actually a reference to my work?? Hmm…..I guess we all can dream.

And, speaking of dreaming…..enjoy Lady K! Lonely Roads vixen!
